entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 13.1 a-b** *दुर्योधनस्य नृपतेः पापा ... ||१३||*
Who was the king whose mind was corrupted?
A) Duryodhana B) Yudhishthira C) Bhishma D) Karna
entry.answer: A) Duryodhana • The verse refers to Duryodhana's corrupted mind ("papā matirajāya"). • Yudhishthira is portrayed as righteous, not corrupt. • Bhishma and Karna are not mentioned in this context.

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 14.1 a-b** *पार्थान्सुमनसो दृष्ट्वा ... वशानुगान् ||१४||*
Whose chariot was destroyed by the Pandavas?
A) Duryodhana B) Arjuna C) Bhima D) Karna
entry.answer: A) Duryodhana • "Pārthānsumanaso" refers to Duryodhana's chariot. • Arjuna and Bhima are allies of the Pandavas. • Karna is a separate warrior, not mentioned here.

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 15.1 a-b** *महिमानं परं चापि ... धार्तराष्ट्रो विवर्णः ||१५||*
Who was described as "vivarna" (pale) in the text?
A) Duryodhana B) Yudhishthira C) Bhishma D) Kripa
entry.answer: A) Duryodhana • Duryodhana's pale complexion is explicitly mentioned. • Yudhishthira is associated with righteousness, not pallor. • Bhishma and Kripa are not described as pale here.

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 16.1 a-b** *श्रियं च तामनुपमां ... धीमतः ||१६||*
Whose wealth was described as "anupamā" (unparalleled)?
A) Duryodhana B) Yudhishthira C) Bhishma D) Karna
entry.answer: B) Yudhishthira • Yudhishthira's wealth ("shriyam") is praised. • Duryodhana's wealth is criticized as excessive. • Bhishma and Karna are not linked to this description.

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 17.1 a-b** *प्रमत्तो धृतराष्ट्रस्य ... भाषमाणं पुनः पुनः ||१७||*
Who was described as "pramatta" (mad)?

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 18.1 a-b** *दुर्योधन कुतोमूलं ... गच्छसि ||१८||*
Where did Duryodhana go after his defeat?
A) Indraprastha B) Hastinapura C) Kuru Kingdom D) Lanka
entry.answer: B) Hastinapura • Duryodhana's journey to Hastinapura is implied. • Indraprastha and Lanka are unrelated to this context. • The Kuru Kingdom is his homeland but not the destination here.

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 19.1 a-b** *दृष्ट्वेमां पृथिवीं कृत्स्नां ... श्वेताश्वस्य महात्मनः ||१९||*

A) Duryodhana B) Yudhishthira C) Bhima D) Arjuna

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 20.1 a-b** *तं च यज्ञं तथाभूतं ... तथाभूतं महाद्युते ||२०||*
Whose yajna (sacrifice) was described as "tathabhutam" (as it should be)?
A) Duryodhana B) Yudhishthira C) Bhishma D) Kripa
entry.answer: B) Yudhishthira • Yudhishthira's yajna is praised for its righteousness. • Duryodhana's yajna is criticized for excess. • Bhishma and Kripa are not mentioned in this context.

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 21.1 a-b** *अमर्षेण सुसम्पूर्णो ... शुष्ये तोयमिवाल्पकम् ||२१||*
What did Duryodhana compare his wealth to?
A) River B) Mountain C) Ocean D) Forest
entry.answer: C) Ocean • Duryodhana's wealth is likened to an ocean. • River and forest are not mentioned here. • Mountain is a metaphor for strength, not wealth.

entry.question:
**Dhritarashtra-parvan 22.1 a-b** *पश्य सात्वतमुख्येन ... न च तत्र पुमानासीत्कश्चित्तस्य पदानुगः ||२२||*
Who was described as "sātvatamukhyan" (son of Satyavata)?
A) Duryodhana B) Yudhishthira C) Bhima D) Arjuna
entry.answer: D) Arjuna • Arjuna is the son of Subhadra (Satyavata's daughter). • Yudhishthira is the son of Kunti. • Bhima and Duryodhana are unrelated to this lineage.
